content:
I'm glad you're excited to give Babylon 5 a try!

There is no reboot of Babylon 5, so you can start with the original series. The show was created by J. Michael Straczynski and aired from 1994 to 1998. It consists of 5 seasons, with a total of 110 episodes.

The original series is a self-contained story, and it's widely regarded as a classic of science fiction television. It's a great starting point, and you can experience the show as it was originally intended.

If you're concerned about the show's age or production quality, rest assured that Babylon 5 still holds up well today. The special effects may not be as polished as modern shows, but the writing, characters, and themes remain strong.

As you watch the show, keep in mind that it was created in the 1990s, and some of the pacing and storytelling conventions may differ from modern TV. However, the show's complexity, character development, and thematic depth are still impressive by today's standards.

When you start watching, you might notice that the first season is a bit slow-burning, as the show sets up its universe and characters. However, as the series progresses, the storylines become more complex, and the stakes escalate.

If you need to adjust your viewing schedule to fit in Babylon 5, you could try watching 2-3 episodes at a time, as I mentioned earlier. This will help you get a better sense of the story arcs and character developments.

Enjoy your journey into the Babylon 5 universe!
